column1: 0045|quarter of one|It was a banging shutter somewhere below that woke me. I picked my watch up from the night table and saw it was quarter of one. I didnâ€™t think there was going to be any more sleep for me until that banging stopped
column4: then returned to the closet for my slicker. When I got downstairs
column5: I paused. From the big bedroom down the hall from the parlor
column6: I could hear Mrs. S sawing wood in long
column7: noisy strokes. No banging shutter was going to break her rest.

column3: Mr. Yoshogi told me that owing to the war there were now many more women in England than men.

column1: 0045|third quarter after midnight|At the thought he jumped to his feet and took down from its hook the coat in which he had left Miss Viner's letter. The clock marked the third quarter after midnight
column2: and he knew it would make no difference if he went down to the post-box now or early the next morning; but he wanted to clear his conscience
column3: and having found the letter he went to the door.
